intro: Ceropegia fusiformis, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Ceropegia fusiformis is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
